result.execSummary:
The defendant James A. Johnson III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A. Johnson III

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case called: 11:35 a.m. 
Clerk: Heather.      
INCLUDES: 22CM384, 22CT91.
State appears by ADA Alex Lech; Defendant appears w/Atty Peter Rotter;

Date and time set for a plea in 22CM384.
ADA Lech indicates defendant is trying to get his license and requests a PTC for 22CT91.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

PLEA: 
CT 1 (Disorderly Conduct - Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 6 days in MCJ; CC plus DNA surcharge; DNA sample; 6 days credit. 

DATES:
CC: 6/28/22 @ 1:00 p.m. (to set PTC in 22CT91)

Adjourned: 11:47 a.m.
Plea hearing on June 23, 2022 at 10:40 am.

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 9:21 am.
INCLUDES: 22CM384 & 22CT91
Defendant appears in person. 

James Johnson sworn and testifies. 
Court questions defendant RE: Employment/Income. 
Court appoints Attorney Peter Rotter @ $100/hr. not to exceed $700 without further order of the Court. 
Wage Assignment: $100/month

Adj:9:23 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: ADA Lech appears; Deft appears pro se; Deft does not qualify for SPD and is requesting counsel; IH and PTC set;

Indigency hearing on May 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2022 at 03:40 pm.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case called: 9:51 am 
INCLUDES 22CM384 & 22CT91. 
Deft does NOT appear. 
Court denies apptment of Counsel. 
Adj: 9:51 am

Indigency hearing on April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

INCLUDES 22CM384 & 22CT91: Absolute sobriety from and no possession o alcohol.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:23 p.m. 
INCLUDES: 22CT91, 22CM384. 
State appears by ADA Alex Lech.  Defendant appears from MCJ via Zoom, with Atty Heather Roehr, in person.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA: NOT GUILTY on CMs

COURT ORDERS: $500.00 signature bond to cover both files.

CONDITIONS: 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

Defendant's Phone: 715-393-5507.

DATES:
IH: 4/25/22 @ 9:30 a.m. BR.
